TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , who was born in DATE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG . The respondent Government were represented by Ms I. GPE , ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant arrived in GPE at DATE . Allegedly , he intended to apply for asylum immediately and , as he only speaks his mother tongue , he went to his brother in GPE to seek his assistance . The brother was ill and unable to help him , however , so he left for ORG where , apparently , some friends of his live . He arrived in ORG on DATE and allegedly intended to file his asylum application on DATE , after the PERSON DATE . However , during DATE , on DATE , he assaulted a NORP national and was arrested and detained by the police . Initially , he presented a false NORP passport but , eventually , he disclosed his true identity and requested asylum .
On DATE ORG ( tingsrätten ) of ORG decided to detain the applicant on suspicion of assault .
By a judgment of DATE ORG convicted the applicant for assault and use of a false document ( brukande av falsk urkund ) and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment .

Following his release from prison on DATE the applicant was taken into custody in accordance with a decision of ORG ( Migrationsverket ) of DATE , as there was a risk that he would otherwise disappear . The applicant was moved to the ORG 's custody LOC at LOC .

In his asylum application , the applicant stated that , following the completion of his military service in DATE , he had returned to his home town . After DATE he had been approached by members of the organisation ORG ) who had threatened his life and told him that he had to work for the organisation . DATE he had regularly transported ORG members in his minibus and also delivered oil and gas to the ORG . On several occasions , ORG members had visited him in his home and threatened to kill him and his family should he not cooperate . Towards DATE the NORP police had also been looking for him at his home . He had never sought the help of the police for fear of reprisals from the PERSON and the police who , allegedly , would not have believed that he had been forced to help the ORG . Following the visit by the police , the applicant had got scared and left for GPE where his sister lived . Someone had helped him out of the country ; he had travelled to GPE , GPE by plane and from there to GPE by truck . He had stayed in GPE for DATE and eventually travelled to GPE by boat . Allegedly , he had not left GPE earlier , as he had been unable to make up his mind and had not known where to go . Moreover , had it not been for the threats from the PERSON , he would not have left the country . According to his parents in GPE , the PERSON and the police had come to look for him several times after his escape . However , he had never been politically active and had not had any difficulties with the NORP police or other authorities .

On DATE ORG rejected the asylum application and ordered the applicant 's expulsion from GPE . It also decided that the applicant should remain in custody . ORG noted that the general situation in GPE was no longer such as to constitute a reason for granting asylum . As regards the applicant 's personal situation , ORG did not find the applicant 's allegations credible . It noted that he had not applied for asylum until he was arrested by the police , DATE after his arrival in GPE , although the alleged reason for his travelling to GPE was to seek asylum . Even when arrested he first lied about his true identity . The ORG therefore considered that the applicant could not have thought that his need for protection was particularly great . ORG also found it peculiar that he had worked for the ORG under threats to his life for as long a period as DATE without having tried to escape . Allegedly , as he had a valid NORP passport and had completed his military service he should have been able to leave GPE without any difficulties at an earlier date . As an alternative , he could have left for GPE to live with his sister . For these reasons , ORG concluded that it was not plausible that , upon return to GPE , the applicant would be subjected to treatment contrary to LAW .

On DATE ORG ( Utlänningsnämnden ) , agreeing with the reasons given by ORG , upheld the above decision . It decided also that the applicant should remain in custody . ORG had at its disposal an “ incident report ” , dated DATE , from the LOC custody , according to which the applicant had tried to hurt himself in custody . He was given medication and put under constant surveillance .

According to another “ incident report ” of DATE the applicant , on that date , after having been informed of ORG decision , had collapsed in violent spasms and had again tried to hurt himself by banging his head against the floor . The responsible physician , PERSON , a specialist in general medicine , concluded that the applicant was panic - stricken . As there was a great risk that the applicant would suffer from another similar attack and as the LAW custody did not have the necessary resources , PERSON considered that further custody at ORG was inappropriate . As the applicant could not be considered mentally ill , he could not be admitted to a psychiatric ward . Instead , Dr PERSON recommended that the applicant be moved to the detention centre at GPE which had sufficient personnel and medical resources to take care of him . Accordingly , the applicant was moved to that detention centre in TIME of DATE .

At GPE the applicant was examined , at the request of his lawyer , by PERSON , a specialist in psychiatry from ORG för tortyr- och traumaskadade ; “ ORG ” ) in GPE . According to the opinion of PERSON , issued on DATE , the applicant feared that the ORG would kill him if he were returned to GPE . His fear was based on previous threats to him and his family . On account of that fear , he was unable to communicate properly with other people and had reduced bodily functions . PERSON concluded that the applicant was , most likely , seriously ill due to a lengthy state of fear , that he had reacted like a person facing execution and that the risk of a suicide attempt was very serious . Thus , he should be taken to a psychiatric ward for further examination .
On DATE a new application for asylum , based on the new medical information , was lodged with ORG . DATE the ORG decided not to suspend the enforcement of the expulsion order .
By a judgment of DATE ORG ( länsrätten ) in GPE rejected the applicant 's appeal against ORG decision not to release him from custody .
On DATE , following the ORG 's indication under LAW , ORG stayed the execution of the expulsion order and released the applicant from custody .
On DATE the applicant was taken to hospital and was then transferred to a psychiatric ward .

On DATE Dr PERSON from the ORG again examined the applicant . According to his medical certificate , issued DATE , the applicant was feeling fairly well and safe and was able to give a detailed account of his situation . The applicant showed no signs of depression and did not meet all the criteria for a post - traumatic stress syndrome . According to PERSON , the applicant 's status at the time of the earlier examination , at GPE , could only be seen as an expression of great fear reasonably based on his previous experiences . The detention at GPE and the threat of expulsion from GPE had involved a serious risk of a lasting impairment of the applicant 's health and also a risk of a suicide attempt .
The new application for asylum is still pending before ORG .
